title: Citibank and Aprenda Offer Awards for Peru's Top Microentrepreneurs
summary: Lima - Citibank Peru and Aprenda announced the launch of the 12th Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, Citi Foundation's international initiative that recognizes top microenterprises that are clients of Peruvian microfinance institutions.
tag-1: Citibank and Aprenda Offer Awards for Peru's Top Microentrepreneurs
tag-3: Lima – Citibank Peru and Aprenda announced the launch of the 12th Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, Citi Foundation's international initiative that recognizes top microenterprises that are clients of Peruvian microfinance institutions.
tag-4: The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards are part of Citi's commitment to support successful entrepreneurs who serve as a model for their peers in the region. Every year, microfinance institutions nominate clients for their personal and business merits. The winners receive cash prizes to invest as they choose.
tag-5: "Citibank is committed to Peru's development, and we are pleased to join Aprenda in contributing to the growth of the country's microenterprises," commented Mario Farren, General Manager of Citibank Peru. "These awards recognize Peruvians who are a model for how to do business competitively and responsibly."
tag-6: "The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards also acknowledge the outstanding work of microfinance institutions that give entrepreneurs access to the credit they need to develop their businesses. We are proud to partner with Citibank Peru and the Citi Foundation in an initiative that promotes financial inclusion," Aprenda's General Manager, Ricardo de la Piedra, added.
tag-7: Financial institutions are invited to nominate their best clients and to compete themselves for an award for "Most Innovative Financial Institution." Nominations will be accepted through Thursday, August 31, via the www.premic.pe webpage, which also contains the official award rules.
tag-9: The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards brings with it a total of S/ 90,000 in cash prizes as an incentive for microenterprises to strengthen their growth and productivity. Formally constituted businesses that are clients of a microfinance institution can compete for first and second place in the categories of Retail, Production and Services. A special award will honor the "Microentrepreneur of the Year," who will receive a prize of S/ 25,000.
tag-10: For the second consecutive year, the awards will also include a special S/ 8,000 prize for Young Entrepreneurs, open to business owners between the ages of 18 and 30 whose projects demonstrate growth and innovation. Like candidates in the other categories, these young participants must be nominated by their financial institutions.
tag-12: The Judges Panel for the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards will comprise the following members: Mario Farren, General Manager, Citibank Peru; Claudia Cornejo Mohme, General Manager, National Confederation of Private Business Institutions (CONFIEP); José Rosas Bermedo, General Manager, Lima Chamber of Commerce (CCL); Rafael Vera Tudela, Standards and Regulatory Manager, National Chamber of Industries (SNI); Carlos Parodi Trece, Economics Department Chair, Universidad del Pacífico; Gabriel Amaro Alzamora, Executive Director, Association of Agricultural Producer Organizations of Peru (AGAP); Carlos Drago Correa, Former Corporate Banking Director, Citibank Peru; Graciela Fernández-Baca, Director, Instituto Cuánto; Hernando Guerra-García, President, National Association of Entrepreneurs (ANDE); Janina León Castillo, Senior Professor, Economics Department, Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú (PUCP); and Narda Sotomayor Valenzuela, Head Microfinance Institutions Analyst, Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and Pensions (SBS).
tag-13: * All references to ""Citibank" or "Citibank Peru" should be understood to mean Citibank del Perú S.A. * All references to "Citi" should be understood to mean Citigroup.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
